61
INVALIDATION OF A WILL
(1) The invalidation of a will due to the testator being of unsound mind or due to the fact that the testator was not fully fifteen years old, as well as the invalidation of a will or the individual provisions of a will due to threat, duress, fraud or error, may only be claimed by a person who has a legal interest within a year of the day he or she uncovered the reason for invalidity, but at the latest ten years after the proclamation of the will.
(2) The one-year period cannot start prior to the proclamation of the will.
(3) The invalidity of a will with regard to a dishonest person can be claimed for up to twenty years after its proclamation.
